questions.question_text:
Risk is configured by default, to calculate Risk = High for a change that is scheduled with only 3 days lead time. Your customerâ€™s change policy requires that changes be requested with 5 days lead time.
How would you satisfy this requirement?

choices.E: Projects are used to do root cause analysis for releases
choices.B: Projects can be part of one or more releases
choices.C: Project features are components of a release
choices.D: Projects need to be completed before releases can be defined
choices.A: Project tasks and Release tasks are interchangeable

questions.question_text: How are Releases related to Projects?
What baseline Change Flows support the baseline Normal Change model?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
From the book:
Change - Normal - Assess
Change - Normal - Authorize
Change - Normal - Implement

AAI :) Assess Authorize Implement

I see confusion here. This is talking about the Flows in Flow Designer, NOT the change model state.

Change model state for a normal Change is New - Assess - Authorize - Schedule - Implement - Review - Close

But this is talking about the Flows in flow designer
Change - Normal - Assess
Change - Normal - Authorize
Change - Normal - Implement

Hope that helps

Selected Answer: A
IT Service Management (ITSM) Implementation On Demand 
Module 7.4 Change Management
Page: Change Flows

Answer is A

Change - Normal - Assess
Change - Normal - Authorize
Change - Normal - Implement
A.Tokyo ebook-p444
A is correct like others have mentioned. Pg 439 and 440.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct because other options are wrong.
But actually it should be New - Assess - Authorize - Schedule - Implement - Review - Close

Selected Answer: A
A is an OK answer, but not really the correct answer.
The correct flow is NEW - ASSESS - AUTHORIZE - SCHEDULE - IMPLEMENT - REVIEW - CLOSE

Selected Answer: A
A, p 444

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Change - Normal - Assess
Change - Normal - Authorize
Change - Normal - Implement

questions.question_text: Which of the following Change Task Types are available by default? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABC
Planning
Implementation
Testing
Review
Planning ,implementation ,testing and review

Selected Answer: ABC
IT Service Management (ITSM) Implementation On Demand 
Module: 7.4 Change Management
Page: Change Tasks

Answer is ABC

Selected Answer: ABC
A, B, C > - 452
ITSM Implementation (Tokyo) ebook p452

Selected Answer: ABC
ABC is the correct answer.
A change task is a piece of work related to the change request. For example, there can be tasks to plan the change, implement the change, and test, and review the work.

Plan
Design
Build
Test
Review

Selected Answer: ABC
correct

Planning
Implementation
Testing
Review
